title: How to Transfer Files from iPod to a New Computer Without the Old Computer

steps.headline: Make sure your iPod is set up for disk use.
steps.description: You can do this by following this article http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1478

steps.headline: Find your iPod under the list of drives.
Get to Options.
steps.description: On Windows Vista, go to Organize. On Windows XP, go to Tools (at the top).

steps.headline: Select the View tab at the top.
Open the folder entitled iPod_Control, located on the iPod drive
Select all of the folders in it, and select Copy from the Organize menu.
Paste the files into your iTunes folder.
After the transfer completes, re-install iTunes.
steps.description: Once you see your files in iTunes, it is safe to sync your iPod.

text: Make sure your iPod is set up for disk use. You can do this by following this article http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1478 Open My Computer.  Find your iPod under the list of drives.  Get to Options. On Windows Vista, go to Organize. On Windows XP, go to Tools (at the top). Select the View tab at the top.  Select Show Hidden Folders.  Open the folder entitled iPod_Control, located on the iPod drive  Go into the Music folder.  Select all of the folders in it, and select Copy from the Organize menu.  Paste the files into your iTunes folder.  After the transfer completes, re-install iTunes. Once you see your files in iTunes, it is safe to sync your iPod.
sentences: Make sure your iPod is set up for disk use.
You can do this by following this article http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1478 Open My Computer.
Find your iPod under the list of drives.
On Windows Vista, go to Organize.
On Windows XP, go to Tools (at the top).
Select the View tab at the top.
Open the folder entitled iPod_Control, located on the iPod drive  Go into the Music folder.
Select all of the folders in it, and select Copy from the Organize menu.
Paste the files into your iTunes folder.
After the transfer completes, re-install iTunes.
Once you see your files in iTunes, it is safe to sync your iPod.
